The prevailing types of theories attempting to account for the existence of humour include psychological theories, the vast majority of which consider humour-induced behaviour to be very healthy; spiritual theories, which may, for instance, consider humour to be a \"gift from God\"; and theories which consider humour to be an unexplainable mystery, very much like a mystical experience.
